tool.name: PercolatorAdapter
tool.description: Facilitate input to Percolator and reintegrate.
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing #if $in: mkdir in && ${ ' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in/%s.%s' &&" % (_, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _]) } #end if #if $in_decoy: mkdir in_decoy && ${ ' '.join(["ln -s '%s' 'in_decoy/%s.%s' &&" % (_, re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in_decoy if _]) } #end if #if $in_osw: mkdir in_osw && ln -s '$in_osw' 'in_osw/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_osw.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_osw.ext)' && #end if mkdir out && #if "out_pin_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir out_pin && #end if #if "weights_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') mkdir weights && #end if #if $adv_opts_cond.adv_opts_selector=='advanced': #if $adv_opts_cond.init_weights: mkdir adv_opts_cond.init_weights && ln -s '$adv_opts_cond.init_weights' 'adv_opts_cond.init_weights/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $adv_opts_cond.init_weights.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($adv_opts_cond.init_weights.ext)' && #end if #if $adv_opts_cond.fasta: mkdir adv_opts_cond.fasta && ln -s '$adv_opts_cond.fasta' 'adv_opts_cond.fasta/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $adv_opts_cond.fasta.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($adv_opts_cond.fasta.ext)' && #end if #end if
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' '$hardcoded_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd #if $in: -in ${' '.join(["'in/%s.%s'"%(re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in if _])} #end if #if $in_decoy: -in_decoy ${' '.join(["'in_decoy/%s.%s'"%(re.sub('[^\w\-_]', '_', _.element_identifier), $gxy2omsext(_.ext)) for _ in $in_decoy if _])} #end if #if $in_osw: -in_osw 'in_osw/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in_osw.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in_osw.ext)' #end if -out 'out/output.${out_type}' #if "out_pin_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -out_pin 'out_pin/output.${gxy2omsext("tabular")}' #end if #if "weights_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') -weights 'weights/output.${gxy2omsext("txt")}' #end if #if $adv_opts_cond.adv_opts_selector=='advanced': #if $adv_opts_cond.init_weights: -init-weights 'adv_opts_cond.init_weights/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $adv_opts_cond.init_weights.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($adv_opts_cond.init_weights.ext)' #end if #if $adv_opts_cond.fasta: -fasta 'adv_opts_cond.fasta/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $adv_opts_cond.fasta.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($adv_opts_cond.fasta.ext)' #end if #end if #if len(str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',')) == 0 | tee '$stdout' #end if
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${out_type}' '$out' #if "out_pin_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'out_pin/output.${gxy2omsext("tabular")}' '$out_pin' #end if #if "weights_FLAG" in str($OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS).split(',') && mv 'weights/output.${gxy2omsext("txt")}' '$weights' #end if #if "ctd_out_FLAG" in $OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS && mv '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$ctd_out' #end if

param.name: in
param.label: Input file(s)

param.name: in_decoy
param.label: Input decoy file(s) in case of separate searches

param.name: in_osw
param.label: Input file in OSW format

param.name: out_type
param.label: Output file type -- default: determined from file extension or content

param.name: enzyme
param.label: Type of enzyme: no_enzyme,elastase,pepsin,proteinasek,thermolysin,chymotrypsin,lys-n,lys-c,arg-c,asp-n,glu-c,trypsin,trypsinp

param.name: peptide_level_fdrs
param.label: Calculate peptide-level FDRs instead of PSM-level FDRs

param.name: protein_level_fdrs
param.label: Use the picked protein-level FDR to infer protein probabilities
param.help: Use the -fasta option and -decoy-pattern to set the Fasta file and decoy pattern

param.name: osw_level
param.label: OSW: Either "ms1", "ms2" or "transition"; the data level selected for scoring

param.name: score_type
param.label: Type of the peptide main score

param.name: generic_feature_set
param.label: Use only generic
param.help: (i.e. not search engine specific) features. Generating search engine specific features for common search engines by PSMFeatureExtractor will typically boost the identification rate significantly

param.name: subset_max_train
param.label: Only train an SVM on a subset of <x> PSMs, and use the resulting score vector to evaluate the other PSMs
param.help: Recommended when analyzing huge numbers (>1 million) of PSMs. When set to 0, all PSMs are used for training as normal

param.name: cpos
param.label: Cpos, penalty for mistakes made on positive examples
param.help: Set by cross validation if not specified

param.name: cneg
param.label: Cneg, penalty for mistakes made on negative examples
param.help: Set by cross validation if not specified

param.name: testFDR
param.label: False discovery rate threshold for evaluating best cross validation result and the reported end result

param.name: trainFDR
param.label: False discovery rate threshold to define positive examples in training

param.name: maxiter
param.label: Maximal number of iterations

param.name: quick_validation
param.label: Quicker execution by reduced internal cross-validation

param.name: init_weights
param.label: Read initial weights to the given file

param.name: default_direction
param.label: The most informative feature given as the feature name, can be negated to indicate that a lower value is bette

param.name: verbose
param.label: Set verbosity of output: 0=no processing info, 5=all

param.name: unitnorm
param.label: Use unit normalization [0-1] instead of standard deviation normalization

param.name: test_each_iteration
param.label: Measure performance on test set each iteration

param.name: override
param.label: Override error check and do not fall back on default score vector in case of suspect score vecto

param.name: seed
param.label: Setting seed of the random number generato

param.name: doc
param.label: Include description of correct features

param.name: klammer
param.label: Retention time features calculated as in Klammer et al

param.name: fasta
param.label: Provide the fasta file as the argument to this flag, which will be used for protein grouping based on an in-silico digest (only valid if option -protein-level-fdrs is active)

param.name: decoy_pattern
param.label: Define the text pattern to identify the decoy proteins and/or PSMs, set this up if the label that identifies the decoys in the database is not the default (Only valid if option -protein-level-fdrs is active)

param.name: post_processing_tdc
param.label: Use target-decoy competition to assign q-values and PEPs

param.name: train_best_positive
param.label: Enforce that, for each spectrum, at most one PSM is included in the positive set during each training iteration
param.help: If the user only provides one PSM per spectrum, this filter will have no effect

param.name: ipf_max_peakgroup_pep
param.label: OSW/IPF: Assess transitions only for candidate peak groups until maximum posterior error probability

param.name: ipf_max_transition_isotope_overlap
param.label: OSW/IPF: Maximum isotope overlap to consider transitions in IPF

param.name: ipf_min_transition_sn
param.label: OSW/IPF: Minimum log signal-to-noise level to consider transitions in IPF

param.name: force
param.label: Overwrite tool specific checks

param.name: test
param.label: Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only)

param.name: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS
param.label: Optional outputs
param.option: out_pin (Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only))
weights (Enables the test mode (needed for internal use only))

data.name: out_pin
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: out_pin
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "out_pin_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: weights
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: weights
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "weights_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

data.name: ctd_out
data.label: ${tool.name} on ${on_string}: ctd
data.filter: OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS is not None and "ctd_out_FLAG" in OPTIONAL_OUTPUTS

tool.help:
Facilitate input to Percolator and reintegrate.
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/documentation/TOPP_PercolatorAdapter.html
